item.title: base tag
item.description: TIL about the base HTML tag. It specifies the base URL to be used for all relative URLs within a document. <base href="http://www.example.com/"> <!-- Refers to: http://www.example.com/#relative --> <a href="#relative">Relative</a> It is supported by all major browsers.

item.title: template tag
item.description: TIL about the template tag. It’s used to hold client-side content that is not to be rendered when a page is loaded but may subsequently be instantiated during runtime using JavaScript. Let’s see some client side input without the template tag: let container = document.createElement('div'); // This will trigger the alert container.innerHTML = "<img src=x onerror=alert(1)>" Now let’s use the <template> tag: let container = document.createElement('template'); // Alert NOT triggered container.
